title: Republican People's Party
summary: The Republican People's Party (Turkish: Cumhuriyet Halk Partisi, pronounced [dʒumhuːɾiˈjet haɫk 'paɾtisi] (listen), abbreviated CHP [dʒehepe]) is the oldest political party in Turkey,[11] founded by Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, the first president and founder of Modern Turkey. The party is also cited as “the founding party of modern Turkey".[12] The CHP describes itself as a ''modern social-democratic party, which is faithful to the founding principles and values of the Republic of Turkey".[13][14] Its logo consists of the Six Arrows, which represent the foundational principles of Kemalism: republicanism, reformism, laicism, populism, nationalism, and statism. It is currently the main opposition party in the Grand National Assembly against the ruling conservative AKP, with 136 MPs.
